result.execSummary:
The defendant David Hinojosa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge 
--to pay subpoena fees of $66 .

The Court grants installment payments of $50 per month beginning 5/6/15 and on the 6th day of the month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in 24 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence in being.  

--to provide DNA sample upon demand by designee. The Sheriff is ordered to collect sample

-- serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on   5/6/2015 at  7:00pm

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

06-23-2015 - Huber may be reinstated on 8/1/15 as long as no prescribed medication is consumed.

Case called at 4:18 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant David  Hinojosa in court, in-custody. No appearance by or for the State. Assistant Corporation Counsel, Yelena Zarwell appears for Sheriff's Department.
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Corporation Counsel has determined that on this particular case, will appear on behalf of Jefferson County. Have conlcuded that Mr. Hinojosa's Huber shall continue to be denied, presents arguments under 303.08(2).
Mr. Hinojosa informs the Court that he does not believe statutory authority cited  by Atty Zarwell is correct
Court concludes that It has authority in exercise of discretion to approve and withdraw or deny Huber privileges under 303.08(2).
Statements by Mr. Hinojosa; Arguments by Atty Zarwell
Court denies Mr. Hinojosa's request to reinstate Huber privileges until August 1, 2015. Huber may be reinstated on 8/1/15 as long as no prescribed medication is consumed. 
Recess: 4:41 pm
Hearing at 06-23-2015 04:00 pm
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:32pm [mo]
Defendant David  Hinojosa in court, in custody.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Mr. Hinojosa's 6/8/15 Request for Huber Reinstatement:
ADA Shock raises issue that he does not represent the Sheriff, rather that would be the role of Corporation Counsel.
--The Court agrees with ADA Shocks analysis
The Court questions whether the State has interest in the revocation of Huber.
--ADA Shock indicates that this is a jail rule violation; not a violation of Court's order regarding sentence.

Atty. Yelena Zarwell, present in the gallery addresses the Court as to the Court's analogy of the proceedings.
The Court allows the State to be dismissed from this hearing.(ADA Shock takes seat in gallery)

Atty. Yelena Zarwell for Corporation Counsel, indicates due to short notice of hearing she is not prepared to represent the Sheriff today.
Atty. Yelena Zarwell requests a hearing next week to allow time to prepare.
--No objection from Mr. Hinojosa
recess:1:44pm 

NEXT: Hearing on Mr. Hinojosa's 6/8/15 Request for Huber Reinstatement: 6/23/15 at 4:00pm

Cases 14CF249, 14CF369, & 14CF371 called at 3:37pm [mo]
Defendant David Hinojosa in court with Attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court and Counsel discuss received email from the victim, Darlene Roy

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Case 14CF249 counts #1 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts in case 14CF249, and all counts in cases 14CF371 & 14CF369 .

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
--addresses the email from Ms. Roy, indicates she cannot be certain who the email came from
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Gonzalez 
Statement made by Mr. Hinojosa
Through Atty. Gonzalez, Mr. Hinojosa rejects Probation

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--On Case 14CF249 Count #1 serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on   5/6/2015 at 7:00pm
--On Count 1: to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge 
--On Count 4: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge 
--to pay subpoena fees of $66 within 60 days or The Court grants installment payments of $50 per month beginning 5/6/15 and on the 6th day of the month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in 24 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence in being.  
--to provide DNA sample upon demand by designee. The Sheriff is ordered to collect sample

Defendant David  Hinojosa in court with Attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Gonzalez indicates that he is newly appointed to the case and may need to request a continuance of the Trial dates to have additional meetings with the State.
The State verifies victim rights compliance
The Court informs Atty. Gonzalez that case 14CF369, with a Jury Trial date of 4/9/2015, does involve a child victim and under statutory law the case must be expedited. 
The Court directs Atty. Gonzalez to put his energy into preparing for Trial rather than negotiating with the State. 
The Court directs the Clerk to remove the 14CF371 Jury Trial from the calendar, but keep the FSSC date on the calendar.

Case called at 11:48am [MO & MK]
Defendant David Hinojosa in court with Attorney John Rhiel.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
This case is scheduled for FSSC today and for Jury Trial later this week. 
Atty. Rhiel raises that Mr. Hinojosa does not feel he has been properly represented and Atty. Rhiel wishes to withdraw from all of Mr. Hinojosa's cases at this time.
The State does not object.
The Court grants Atty. Rhiel's Motion to Withdraw as defense counsel. The Public Defenders Office will appoint new counsel. 
The Court recalls cases #14CF369 and #14CF371 at this time(11:52am). The Court grants the motion to withdraw from all of Mr. Hinojosa's cases.
The Court and Counsel discuss new scheduling times. 
The Court confirms that the Jury Trial set for later this week in Case #14CF249 is cancelled.
recess: 11:55am

NEXT: Set all three cases for STC, in at least 2 weeks out to allow adequate time for new counsel to be appointed.

case called at 8:41am. 
Defendant David Hinojosa in court with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Officer R.J. Wagner--sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Rhiel

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Hinojosa committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--in response to the Court's inquiry, ADA Hall indicates that the property damaged in relation to the Criminal Damage to Property count is a cellphone. 
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Mr. Hinojosa verifies that the McComb Street, Fort Atkinson address remains current.
Attorney Rhiel seeks for the Court to allow him to contact the property owner of the residence of Ms. Roy, to make arrangements for Mr. Hinojosa to go to the residence to remove his personal property, after the landlord has received verification that Ms. Roy and Ms. Monk have vacated, and the landlord has the keys to the unit.
The Court amends the Bond to add an exception that Mr. Hinojosa may be present at 604 East Street to remove any additional personal belongings, only after receiving notification from the landlord that Ms. Roy and Ms. Monk have moved out. The Court clarifies that under these circumstances, Mr. Hinojosa does not need to be accompanied by a law enforcement officer.  
recess 8:53am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/17/14 at 2:20pm  (2) schedule Status Conference approximately 2-3 weeks after the Pretrial date
Attorney Rhiel

Prior: N6465 Mansfield Rd., Lake Mills, WI 53551 United States

Case called at 9:01 am [Clerk SH] (On Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond)
Defendant David Hinojosa in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall informs the Court that as long as the Court can fashion an order in which the Defendant takes only his belongings & has no contact with alleged victim, the State will not object
Atty Rhiel provides argument in support of motion
Court presents concerns about fashioning an order as It does not have jurisdiction over 3rd parties mentioned in argument, nor do those individuals have idea on which property is Mr. Hinojosa's and which is Ms. Roy's
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that he would be willing to try an contact the alleged victim

Court allows, that upon Atty Rhiel being able to negotiate some meeting time, that Mr. Hinojosa may be present at 604 East St. in the presence of law enforcement, if they are willing, to obtain his personal belongings. Mr. Hinojosa may only take property that Ms. Roy and Ms. Monk agree are his and he may only be present at that property in the presence of law enforcement.

Court presents basis and modifies bond to a $2000 signature bond with conditions:
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No presence at 218 Edward St. Fort Atkinson
-No contact with Darlene Roy or Peter Scheibel
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-Court allows Mr. Hinojosa to be present at 604 East St. in the presence of law enforcement only to obtain his personal belongings. Mr. Hinojosa may only take those items that Skyleigh Monk and Darlene Roy agree are his.

NEXT:  Case to remain as scheduled
Defendants motion to modify bond
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Criminal complaint with original signatures
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
